name: hatha yoga and flow session
description: This day retreat provides a unique experience that combines the benefits of Hatha yoga, flow sessions, and plant-based meals in a picturesque natural setting. Hatha yoga, a practice that encourages well-being through the combination of laughter and deep breathing, helps release tension and promotes a positive mindset. Flow sessions, which blend movement and mindfulness techniques, aim to cultivate inner peace and harmony. The just be cafe , by nidhi nahata offers a variety of nourishing meals designed to satisfy both the body and the soul, ensuring that participants feel revitalized and rejuvenated. Immerse yourself in nature and take this opportunity to reconnect with your mind, body, and spirit. Whether you are looking to relax, recharge, or simply enjoy the beauty of the surroundings, this retreat offers a holistic approach to wellness that will leave you feeling refreshed and inspired.

name: The Courtyard Baithak- An Evening of Hindustani Classical Music
description: This will be Courtyard Baithak's first classical recital. The Baithak will feature Khayal, Thumri, and Abhang by Siddhartha Belmannu.The Courtyard Baithak series is curated by tabla wizard and prodigy Trilochan Kampli, who with his uncompromising standards in music, evokes the best from every artist that he invites to perform. We are bringing musicians and audiences together on a sublime musical journey.Exclusive gatherings, quiet strains of exquisite music, and dedicated artists across selected genres - The Courtyard Baithak series promises a true classical musical experience.Please note: The ticket includes performance onlyAbout the Artist - Siddhartha BelmannuSiddhartha Belmannu is acclaimed as a musical prodigy and a trailblazer in Indian classical music. Hailing from Karkala, a quaint town in the Udupi district of Karnataka, Siddhartha’s remarkable vocal talent was evident from an early age. His musical journey began with Carnatic Classical Music, but it was under the esteemed guidance of Sri P.R. Manjunath that he delved into Hindustani Classical Music. His path took a transformative turn with the mentorship of Pandit Vinayak Torvi, a revered maestro of the Gwalior and Kirana gharanas. This extensive training, spanning 13 years in the Gurukul system, allowed Siddhartha to refine his skills and create a distinct style that harmoniously blends tradition with contemporary innovation. His exceptional achievements earned him a special mention in Forbes’ '30 under 30' list for 2021 in the music category.Terms and Conditions:The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during the event.No liability or claims arising from the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Valet service is available at a charge of Rs. 200 per vehicle.Children aged 5 and older require a ticket.Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. If you prefer not to be featured, please inform our team.Tickets are non-refundable in case of cancellation or no-show.In case of rain, the event will be moved indoors.

name: Fireback, Goa at The Conservatory
description: About the MealFireback's a la carte menu is a tribute to Thailand's rich culinary heritage, showcasing the depth and diversity of its flavors. This thoughtfully curated selection is the creation of Chef Kaustubh Haldipur, who will be presenting it at The Conservatory.Meet Chef Kaustubh Haldipur at The ConservatoryWith over 15 years of experience in Asian cuisine, Chef Kaustubh brings a wealth of expertise to the table. His career spans across esteemed establishments like 'Wasabi by Morimoto' and 'Yauatcha Bengaluru,' and he has led culinary teams at prestigious venues across India and internationally. At Fireback, Chef Kaustubh blends traditional Thai flavors with modern techniques, ensuring each dish is an authentic yet innovative culinary experience.About FirebackFireback, the newest addition to the EHV portfolio, is an exciting Thai restaurant and bar with legendary Chef David Thompson as Culinary Director. Hidden behind an old Portuguese bungalow, it serves authentic Thai food at a picturesque riverside setting in Siolim, Goa. The name is inspired by the Thai national bird, the Siamese Fireback, and reflects the fire-grilled cooking behind many of the dishes. The restaurant, a modern glass house, steps down onto outdoor decks and a promenade overlooking the river. Guests can dine by a fish pond or at riverside tables, with an outdoor bar taking center stage. The stunning St. Anthony’s Church in the distance enhances this unique setting. FIREBACK (A la carte menu)SOUPFresh Coconut Cream, Galangal, Charred Chilies (INR 435)Tofu & king mushroom/ Chicken/ PrawnSMALL PLATESPineapple Som Tam (V) (INR 475)Tamarind, toasted coconut, roasted peanuts, thai bird chilliesKaffir Corn Fritters (V) (INR 490)Served with ajad salad, fresh sambalFireback Fried Chicken (NV) (INR 675)Cumin, shallotsGrilled King Fish Salad (NV) (INR 775)Citrus tomato dressing, raw mango Fried Pork Belly (NV) (INR 995)Charred cabbage, tamarind dipRiver Prawns Three Flavored (NV) (INR 1095)Nam prik chilly paste, fried basilGRILLED  Pumpkin & Sweet Potato (V) (INR 665)Toasted coconut, red chillies Lamb Chop Gorlae (NV) (INR 1195)Toasted coconut, red chilliesLARGE PLATESThai Stir-fried Vegetables (V) (INR 725)lotus root, long beans, pok choy, corn, yellow bean, nam prik chiliKhmoy Green Curry Pea Eggplant, Heart of Palm Vegetarian-INR 745 / Chicken–INR 855 / Red Snapper- INR 1055Aromatic Curry (V) (INR 745)Plantain, pumpkin, deep fried shallots, cucumber relishMassaman Curry Lamb (NV) (INR 1125)Grounded spice, onion, pumpkin, potatoes, peanutSIDES  Steamed Jasmine Rice (INR 295) Fried Rice (V) (INR 575)Sun-dried tomatoes, cashew, spring onionJumbo Lump Crab Fried Rice (NV) (INR 995)Served with cucumber, lemon, corianderDESSERTS Pandanus Noodles (V) (INR 695)Perfumed mix fruits, syrup & iceCashew Nut Pudding (NV) (INR 695)Caramelized taro, fresh coconut creamTerms and Conditions : The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during an eventConservatory is located on the 2nd floor of courtyard which is a 44 steps climb upDo not purchase tickets from anyone other than on the ticketing platform.No-shows and cancellations are non-refundable by all means.Tickets are non-transferable and are for personal use only.Children aged 7 and above require a ticket to attend the meal. name: The Picnic Table by Geist Brewing Co. OMR
description: Indulge in classic dishes that will have you reminiscing about simpler times. We've got a spread of nostalgic favourites alongside refreshing beers and mocktails – something to please all palates! But this isn't just a trip down memory lane. It's a chance to create new memories with loved ones in the vibrant green space of our restaurant. Join us for a day of delicious food, good company, and a touch of sweet nostalgia!Food MenuBread ServiceHerb & Sundried Tomato FocacciaRustic Mini BaguetteSpreads & DipsThe Trio Jar: Marinated Labneh, Coriander & Peanut Pesto, Tomato ChundoHummus with Chilli Crunch & ZaatarChicken Liver PâtéSaladBarley, Bean & Beetroot Salad: Barley, roasted beetroot, curry ranch dressing, cucumber, cherry tomato, pomegranate, Granny Smith apple, orange segments, creamy labneh, lettuce & herbs, pumpkin seedsBurgers & SandwichesCaprese Panini: Tomato chundo, oven-roasted tomato, bocconcini, coriander pesto, arugula, herbed paniniJerk Chicken Panini: Grilled jerk chicken, garlic coriander mayo, pineapple slaw, ciabattaDessertsChocolate Ganache CakeBeverage Menu Mocktail or Coolers: Tiki Taka or canned beveragesCrowlers: Witty Wit, Weiss Guy, and Repeat (6 cans)Terms and Conditions -1) Inclusions: Each ticket includes a picnic basket that serves 3-4 people, containing food and either mocktails or 6 crowlers of beer, depending on the ticket type purchased.2)Refunds and Cancellations: All ticket sales are final. No refunds or cancellations will be entertained.3)Alcohol Consumption: Attendees must be 21 years of age or older to consume alcoholic beverages. Valid ID proof will be required at the event.4)Weather Policy: The event will proceed rain or shine. In the case of severe weather, Geist Brewing Co. reserves the right to cancel the event. Ticket holders will be notified, and a refund or rescheduled date will be provided.5)Photography and Media: By attending the event, attendees consent to being photographed or filmed. Geist Brewing Co. reserves the right to use these images for promotional purposes.6)Food Allergies: Attendees with food allergies or dietary restrictions should inform the event organisers in advance.By purchasing a ticket, you agree to abide by these terms and conditions. We look forward to welcoming you to The Picnic Table by Geist for a memorable day of food and fun.

name: Bring Home Bihar
description: Tijouri is a pioneering Indian restaurant that offers a unique dining experience through monthly pop-ups featuring home chefs from across India. Located at Radisson Blu Atria, Bangalore, Tijouri aims to bring the diverse flavours of India to the heart of Bangalore, celebrating the rich culinary traditions of the country through an authentic and immersive dining experience. Our mission is to preserve traditional recipes and introduce them to a wider audience through both dining experiences and retail products.As our third pop up we Bring Home Bihar by Rachana Prasad. Rachana, Inspired by father & grandfather Rachna wants to showcase the various facets of Bihari cuisine to the world outside of the usual litthi chokka.**** Come prepared for the spice!*****Welcome drink Gud ka SharbatStarterMutton goliJinga PakoraTaruaDal PithaFirst Mains (served with Tikona Paratha)Sarsowali bhindiChamparan Mutton/ Dehati MurgiSecond Mains (served with rice)Godilla (red chickpea mince curry)Chotka Aloo ka BhujiyaRohu MaachliDessertThekua with sorbetThis menu only indicates the food that will be served and is subject to change.Terms & Conditions:Please arrive punctually.Late arrivals may miss the first few courses.Booking Fee are non-refundable under all circumstances once booked. Tickets are transferrable to a third party.No shows/ cancellations will not be refunded, but you can reschedule your booking for within the week 48hrs before your slot is due.Alcohol will not be served to guests under the age of 21No liability or claims that may arise due to the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.The booking fee total includes the online transaction fee.Parking at the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Valet is available.Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. Incase you do not wish to be featured, let our team know.

name: In The House with SG Club, Japan, a Cocktail Bar Takeover at Muro
description: Join us on August 23rd & 24th for an exclusive Japanese cocktail experience as SG Club, Tokyo's finest, transforms MURO into a Japanese-style bar.Experience Japan’s finest craftsmanship, where precision meets artistry. Enjoy impeccable hospitality and savor cocktails created with indigenous ingredients sourced from Japan’s diverse regions. SG Club holds over 50 cumulative awards from “The World’s 50 Best Bars” and “Asia’s 50 Best Bars,” and is currently ranked No.23 in Asia’s 50 Best Bars for 2024.

name: Screening: Past Lives (2023) | Movie Under the Stars
description: Join us for an open-air screening of ”Past Lives” (2023), with a three-course dinner and popcorn.*Wines will be available for purchase at the venue.About the MoviePast Lives (2023) is an Oscar-nominated romantic drama that tells the story of two childhood friends from South Korea, Nora and Hae Sung, who reconnect years after being separated when Nora’s family emigrates to Canada.While primarily in English, Past Lives retains strong ties to Korean culture, making it perfect to enjoy with our curated Korean food pairing. As a piece of world cinema, it offers a unique glimpse into Korean culture while remaining accessible to a global audience, thanks to its English subtitles.The film beautifully explores themes of love, destiny, and cultural identity, delving into the concept of "In-Yun," a Korean belief in fated relationships.With its Oscar nomination, this film is a must-watch for those who appreciate critically acclaimed international cinema paired with the delightful experience of Korean cuisine.3-Course Menu﻿AppetizerVegetarian GimbapMain courseBibimpbap (Veg)ORBibimpbap (Chicken)DessertJiggly cheesecake with caramel sauceSee you at the Yard!﻿Terms and Conditions:The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during the event.No liability or claims arising from the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Valet service is available at a charge of Rs. 200 per vehicle.Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. description: Join fellow travel enthusiasts at the Travel Tales Table, where strangers come together to share their travel tales and make new connections over a delicious meal. Whether you've trekked through mountains or wandered through cities, this gathering is the perfect place to exchange experiences, inspire future adventures, and form friendships with like-minded explorers. Come with your stories, leave with new connections!

name: BENGALURU: OTJF Listening Sessions: The Velvet Underground & Nico
description: Step into the underground at Indiranagar Social's Speakeasy Room as we journey through one of the most influential albums of all time—The Velvet Underground & Nico. Hosted by On The Jungle Floor, this event invites you to explore the raw, revolutionary sounds that defined an era and continue to inspire generations. On 25th of August, 4PM onwards immerse yourself in the avant-garde world of The Velvet Underground. From the haunting allure of "Sunday Morning" to the provocative edge of "Heroin" and the iconic "Venus in Furs," we'll spin the album in its entirety on vinyl, capturing the gritty, unfiltered energy that made this record a cornerstone of music history.Joining us as co-host is illustrator and musician, Sachin Bhatt. Specializing in album art and visual creatives, Sachin has made a significant impact both locally and internationally, having worked with artists like Hiatus Kaiyote, Moonchild, The F16s, Kiefer and more. Who better than Sachin to deep dive into this special album with us?In addition to the immersive listening experience, we're hosting a vinyl pop-up shop. Our crates will be stacked with a curated collection handpicked specially for this session, ready for you to dig through.Whether you're a long-time fan or discovering the album for the first time, join us for an evening of deep listening, reflection, and connection. Expect an evening filled with music, drinks, and conversation as we honor the legacy of The Velvet Underground & Nico.

location.address: Plot 37, 80 Feet Rd, Hal, HAL 3rd Stage, New Tippasandra, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560075, India

organizer.name: On the Jungle Floor LLP

name: Chocolate Profiling Workshop with Manam Chocolate: Unlocking the Endless Possibilities of Cacao
description: About the Workshop at The ConservatoryThis session starts with a brief on the history of Cacao, starting from its Mesoamerican origin and culminating in the present-day transformation into the world of craft chocolate. It traverses through 3 centuries and multiple geo-political events and how they affected the story of Cacao and chocolate and tries to speak about what the future might hold for chocolate and how we at Manam Chocolate see ourselves fit into that narrative. This discussion will be followed by a profiling session that forms an introduction to appreciating craft chocolate. It includes an introduction to aroma training, and taste training and takes the audience through tasting various samples of craft chocolate and defects (Industrial Chocolate). Workshop by CHAITANYA MUPPALA,FOUNDER & CEO, MANAM CHOCOLATE & DISTINCT ORIGINS PRIVATE LIMITED Chaitanya Muppala is the CEO of Distinct Origins Private Limited, which launched Manam Chocolate, an Indian Craft Chocolate brand. A second-generation entrepreneur with over 10 years of experience in the Indian food industry, Chaitanya holds a degree from Sauder School of Business, UBC, and has completed the Stanford Seed Program. In 2021, he founded Distinct Origins to develop India’s fine-flavor cacao industry, establishing the country’s largest cacao fermentary in West Godavari. He also built Manam Chocolate, which launched in August 2023. Before this, Chaitanya led Almond House, a renowned premium sweets brand, expanding its reach across South India.Workshop AgendaIntroduction to Cacao's Origin and History ● Mesoamerican origins of cacao ● Role of cacao in ancient civilizations (Mayans, Aztecs) ● Cacao as a sacred beverage and currency Cacao in the Age of Exploration ● Arrival of cacao in Europe ● Transformation of cacao into a chocolate drink ● Spread of chocolate culture in Europe Industrial Revolution and Mass Production ● Development of chocolate manufacturing processes ● Mass production and availability of chocolate ● Emergence of famous chocolate brands Geo-Political Events and Chocolate ● Impact of World Wars on chocolate production and consumption ● Post-war chocolate boom Craft Chocolate Renaissance ● Rise of craft chocolate makers ● Focus on quality, ethics, and sustainability ● Artisanal production methods and single-origin chocolates Future ● Changing consumer preferences (health-conscious, ethical sourcing) ● Sustainability challenges in cacao farming ● Innovation in chocolate production (flavors, techniques) Manam Chocolates Role in the Narrative ● Our commitment to quality craft chocolate ● Contribution to preserving cacao's heritage and elevating the chocolate experienceIntroduction to Craft Chocolate Appreciation ● Aroma Training:● Importance of aroma in chocolate tasting Trends in Chocolate ● Identifying different aroma profiles (fruity, nutty, floral) ● Taste Training: ● Understanding taste elements (sweetness, acidity, bitterness) ● Recognizing flavour complexities in craft chocolate Chocolate Tasting Session ● Sampling various craft chocolate bars: - Single-origin chocolate - Different flavor profiles (dark, milk, white) - Note-taking and sharing tasting experiences Defect Identification ● Introduction to common defects found in industrial chocolate Conclusion and Q&A Recap of key points in the journey of cacao and chocolate Open floor for questions and discussions about craft chocolate, its appreciation, and the future of the industry. Terms and Conditions : The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur name: Chocolate Profiling Workshop with Manam Chocolate: Unlocking the Endless Possibilities of Cacao
description: About the Workshop at The ConservatoryThis session starts with a brief on the history of Cacao, starting from its Mesoamerican origin and culminating in the present-day transformation into the world of craft chocolate. It traverses through 3 centuries and multiple geo-political events and how they affected the story of Cacao and chocolate and tries to speak about what the future might hold for chocolate and how we at Manam Chocolate see ourselves fit into that narrative. This discussion will be followed by a profiling session that forms an introduction to appreciating craft chocolate. It includes an introduction to aroma training, and taste training and takes the audience through tasting various samples of craft chocolate and defects (Industrial Chocolate). Workshop by CHAITANYA MUPPALA,FOUNDER & CEO, MANAM CHOCOLATE & DISTINCT ORIGINS PRIVATE LIMITED Chaitanya Muppala is the CEO of Distinct Origins Private Limited, which launched Manam Chocolate, an Indian Craft Chocolate brand. A second-generation entrepreneur with over 10 years of experience in the Indian food industry, Chaitanya holds a degree from Sauder School of Business, UBC, and has completed the Stanford Seed Program. In 2021, he founded Distinct Origins to develop India’s fine-flavor cacao industry, establishing the country’s largest cacao fermentary in West Godavari. He also built Manam Chocolate, which launched in August 2023. Before this, Chaitanya led Almond House, a renowned premium sweets brand, expanding its reach across South India.Workshop AgendaIntroduction to Cacao's Origin and History ● Mesoamerican origins of cacao ● Role of cacao in ancient civilizations (Mayans, Aztecs) ● Cacao as a sacred beverage and currency Cacao in the Age of Exploration ● Arrival of cacao in Europe ● Transformation of cacao into a chocolate drink ● Spread of chocolate culture in Europe Industrial Revolution and Mass Production ● Development of chocolate manufacturing processes ● Mass production and availability of chocolate ● Emergence of famous chocolate brands Geo-Political Events and Chocolate ● Impact of World Wars on chocolate production and consumption ● Post-war chocolate boom Craft Chocolate Renaissance ● Rise of craft chocolate makers ● Focus on quality, ethics, and sustainability ● Artisanal production methods and single-origin chocolates Future ● Changing consumer preferences (health-conscious, ethical sourcing) ● Sustainability challenges in cacao farming ● Innovation in chocolate production (flavors, techniques) Manam Chocolates Role in the Narrative ● Our commitment to quality craft chocolate ● Contribution to preserving cacao's heritage and elevating the chocolate experienceIntroduction to Craft Chocolate Appreciation ● Aroma Training:● Importance of aroma in chocolate tasting Trends in Chocolate ● Identifying different aroma profiles (fruity, nutty, floral) ● Taste Training: ● Understanding taste elements (sweetness, acidity, bitterness) ● Recognizing flavour complexities in craft chocolate Chocolate Tasting Session ● Sampling various craft chocolate bars: - Single-origin chocolate - Different flavor profiles (dark, milk, white) - Note-taking and sharing tasting experiences Defect Identification ● Introduction to common defects found in industrial chocolate Conclusion and Q&A Recap of key points in the journey of cacao and chocolate Open floor for questions and discussions about craft chocolate, its appreciation, and the future of the industry. Terms and Conditions : The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during an eventConservatory is located on the 2nd floor of courtyard which is a 44 steps climb upDo not purchase tickets from anyone other than on the ticketing platform.No-shows and cancellations are name: Janapada Kala Darshana
description: "Janapada Kala Darshana" is a vibrant and cultural event that celebrates the essence of rural life, traditions and cuisine of Karnataka. Explore the rich heritage and history of the region with a guided museum tour at Jana Pada loka, showcasing artifacts and exhibits that highlight the cultural significance of the area.Enjoy sumptuous traditional meals at Kamat Lokaruchi, featuring an array of authentic local dishes that are served in a picturesque traditional village setup, offering a taste of rural life.Visit to chennapatna toy workshop run by Shilpa Trust, where artisans craft exquisite traditional toys, offering insights into the age-old art of toy making. Immerse yourself in the cultural heritage of the region with captivating performances like Dollu Kunitha, a dynamic and rhythmic drum dance."Janapada Kala Darshana" promises a delightful blend of cultural immersion, culinary delights, and interactive experiences that showcase the beauty of rural life and traditions.

location.address: Doddamannugudde Forest, Karnataka 562159, India

organizer.name: JANAPADA KALA DARSHANA
organizer.description: "Janapada Kala Darshana" is a vibrant and cultural event that celebrates the essence of rural life, traditions and cuisine of Karnataka.

name: The Kids Playdate - Ganesha Habba!
description: Our monthly playdate is back!The beloved Ganesha play date is here!The LooRoo Club and Courtyard are excited to invite you to a celebration of one of our favourite festivals - Ganesha Habba! The day will be filled with making clay Ganeshas, playing with flowers, listening to stories about him, making sweet treats, and getting your hands messy and creative with some exciting art and fun activities at the play date! True to LooRoo style, we’ll have a whole lot of nature-inspired sensory play that’s as messy as it is magical! Think squishy, slimy, and utterly delightful fun—all in the spirit of Ganesha!For Kids aged 3+ and their parentsTerms and ConditionsThe management bears no responsibility for any injury or damage incurred during the event.Purchase tickets exclusively from the designated ticketing platform.No refunds for no-shows or cancellations under any circumstances.Tickets are non-transferable and intended for personal use only.Event schedule and menu subject to change in case of emergencies or events beyond our control.The management will not entertain liability claims arising from the consumption of food or beverages.Parking near the event venue is at the vehicle owner's risk. Paid valet parking available at Rs. 200 per car.Ticket holders grant organizers perpetual rights to use any recorded video or still footage of their appearance on any channel, without further approval.In case of rain, the event will be moved indoors.

name: Hosa, Goa at The Conservatory | Chef Harish Rao’s Experiments with South Indian Tapas
description: About the MealCurated by the renowned Chef Harish Rao, celebrated for his innovative take on South Indian cuisine, the menu offers a blend of traditional and modern dishes. Guests can savor unique creations like Pondicherry Bouillabaisse, Chicken Paniyaram, Kari Dosa and Mutton Pepper Roast—each crafted to showcase the rich culinary heritage of South India.About Chef Harish RaoChef Harish Rao is a celebrated culinary expert with over 20 years of experience, renowned for his innovative approach to South Indian cuisine. He has successfully led prestigious restaurants like Dakshin in Chennai and played a key role in launching Avartana at ITC Grand Chola. As the Executive Chef at HOSA, Goa, he continues to introduce exciting new dishes that highlight the intricate and diverse flavors of traditional South Indian regional cuisines.About HosaHOSA, meaning ‘new’ in Kannada, redefines South Indian flavors with an innovative twist and a vibrant bar scene. HOSA’s menu features standout dishes like Guntur Crab Fry, ghee roasts, Vada Kari and Curry Leaf-Cured Snapper, all paired with tropical cocktails and an extensive wine list. Recognized as Goa’s ‘Best Modern Indian Restaurant’ and ‘Best Restobar’ by the Times Food & Nightlife Awards in 2023, HOSA also earned accolades in 2024 for ‘Best Modern South Indian’ and ‘Best Cocktails.’ They received four ultimate stars from Culinary Culture Co. 2024HOSA (A la carte menu)Small PlatesVegetarianTomato Rasam (INR 400)Edamame and water chestnut poriyal, lemon oilTengaipal Rasam (INR 400)Spiced young coconut broth, smoked coconut meat, tomato salsa, coriander oilAlmond 65 (INR 600)Crispy almond fritters, yogurt rice, pomeloVazhakai Pepper Roast (INR 600)Raw plantain tossed in onion tomato pepper masalaPotato / Cauliflower (INR 600)Potato fritters, cauliflower masiyal, air-dried green peasShimiji Mushroom Varuval (INR 700)Mushroom mousse, pickled green peppersNon-VegetarianPondicherry Pouyabaisse (INR 650)Grilled seafood. Tamil Pondicherican version of the original BouillabaisseKozhi Rasam (INR 600)Spiced chicken broth, chicken varuvalCured Snapper (INR 1050)Rice pops, herb oil, spiced kokum rasaMutton Pepper Roast (INR 810)Coconut shavings, garlic chipsH F C (Hosa Fried Chicken) (INR 700)Cucumber yogurt dipChicken Paniyaram (INR 700)Madras sundal mousse, chickpea / amarant saladToddy Shop Prawns (INR 850)Raw mango saladKari Dosa (INR 700)Spiced mutton dosa, curried hollandaise, poached eggs. A take on classic Madurai kari dosaLarge PlatesVegetarianTrumpet Mushroom Varuval (INR 840)Wild mushroom pongal, pepper jusAubergine Steak (INR 840)Burnt aubergine mash, sesame peanut curry, yogurt sphereSweet and Sour Pineapple (INR 700)Chargrilled sweet and sour pineapple curryNon-VegetarianKappa Meen Curry (INR 1200)Tapioca mash, grilled seabass, Malabar tamarind sauceG.O.A.T (INR 1200)Tender lamb shank simmered in spicy gravyChicken Serva / Kalaki (INR 830)Our take on the local street foods of Tamil NaduStaples (INR 195 each)Coin PorottaIdiappam – String HoppersSteamed RiceGhee Rice (INR 250)Desserts (INR 550)Ragi Molten Lava CakeOrange ice cream, almond crumbleFilter Coffee TiramisuCoffee, ruskTerms and Conditions : The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during an eventConservatory is located on the 2nd floor of courtyard which is a 44 steps climb upDo not purchase tickets from anyone other than on the ticketing platform.No-shows and cancellations are non-refundable by all means.Tickets are non-transferable and are for personal use only.Children aged 7 and above require a ticket to attend the meal. If you are bringing a child under 7, please inform us in advance, as we do not have a baby seat at the venue.The schedule is subject to change in case of an emergency or any event out of our control.Management will entertain no liability or claims arising due to the consumption or intake of any food or drink.Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Paid Valet Parking at Rs. 200 per car.The holder of this ticket grants organizers the right to use, in perpetuity, all or any part of the recording of any video or still footage made of the holder's appearance on any channel without any further approval.Please note that both vegetarian and non-vegetarian dishes are prepared in the same kitchen.Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. If you do not wish to be featured, let our team know.
